item.title: Xiaogang He
item.description: Assistant Professor of Civil and Environmental Engineering, College of Design and Engineering, National University of Singapore

item.title: Climate Downscaling
item.description: Hybrid statistical-dynamic downscaling based on multi-model ensembles What we are releasing We are releasing a bias-corrected and downscaled dataset based on 14 Coupled Model Intercomparison Project 6 (CMIP6) global climate models (GCMs) and the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts Reanalysis 5 (ERA5) dataset. The dataset is simulated by ERA5 (3 domains) and GCMs (4 domains) forcing in NSCC HPC as shown in the following figure. What is downscaling GCMs under CMIP6 have been widely used to investigate climate change impacts and put forward associated adaptation and mitigation strategies.

item.title: Climate Intelligence
item.description: High-precision climatic datasets and analytics in Southeast Asia

item.title: Data
item.description: Multi-scale, high-resolution, and high-fidelity climate simulations Domains The dataset is simulated using WRF4.3 by ERA5 (3 domains) and GCM (4 domains) forcing in NSCC HPC, as shown below. All output is daily netcdf files with equal area projection at three domains (12.5km: Southeast Asia; 2.5km: Southern Malay Peninsula; 500m: Singapore) Files include names with wrfout_d01_year-mon-day_00:00:00 (first running) and wrfout_d01_year-mon-day_03:00:00 (restart running) Every file has 8 timesteps (0,3,6,9,12,15,18,21 ; or 3,6,9,12,15,18,21,0) Due to the restart running,there are one or more files named by the same day.

item.title: Weather Forecast
item.description: Real-time weather forecast based on AI technologies and big data Background Rainfall continues to be one of the most crucial meteorological variables in many facets of our life. With the onset of global warming, the hydrological cycle is expected to escalate, which further increases the intensity and frequency of extreme rainfall events and the risk of flooding. These events have grim socio-economic impacts on ruining communities, infrastructure, agriculture and other human-environment systems.

item.title: About
item.description: We are a group of AI enthusiasts with a diverse background in climate science, hydrology, Earth system modeling, and civil and environmental engineering. Our mission is to build Singaporeâ€™s Climate ArtificiaL intelligence Engine (SgCALE) to predict highly-localized urban climate extremes e.g., floods, droughts, heat waves) harnessing machine learning.
